description: U.S. officials have largely attributed the decline to more enforcement in Mexico, including in yards where migrants are known to board freight trains.
title: Arrests at the U.S. border fall in April, bucking usual spring increase

description: Citing climate change, federal land managers are moving to end new leasing for coal in the country's top producing region.
title: Biden ending new leases in America's top coal region

description: Stock markets received a boost from new data showing inflation is easing. Lower inflation has raised hopes about the U.S. economy — but there are still a lot of unknowns.
title: The Dow Jones hits 40,000 for the first time. What to know about this major milestone

description: Georgia State University says the students were not sent an official acceptance letter but "communication" from a department welcoming those who intend to major in a specific academic area.
title: 1,500 college applicants thought they were accepted. They soon learned it was an error

description:
While Israel's government has strongly rejected the idea that the International Criminal Court could prosecute Israeli's accused of war crimes in Gaza, many in Israel say the military doesn't do an adequate job holding it's own soldiers accountable. Our correspondent looks into how the Israeli military polices itself.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: How Does Israel's Military Investigate Itself?

description: Harrison Butker of the Kansas City Chiefs urged female graduates to embrace the title of "homemaker" in a controversial commencement speech. The NFL says he was speaking "in his personal capacity."
title: The NFL responds after a player urges female college graduates to become homemakers

description: Once an ally of the former president, now Cohen is in his third day of testifying against him. He alleges Trump knew about the deal with an adult film star to keep quiet about an alleged affair.
title: Michael Cohen continues cross-examination in Trump's criminal hush money trial

description: More than a million people could get health care if these states would pass laws expanding Medicaid. Most residents want the expansion but entrenched politics stands in the way.
title: Here's what's holding back Medicaid expansion in Mississippi and other Southern states

description: Under the new law, climate change will largely disappear from state statutes. Critics say the move ignores the risks of climate change facing Florida, including rising seas, flooding and extreme heat.
title: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signs a bill that strikes climate change from state law

description: Plus, six tips on how to stay alert and minimize sluggishness when traveling rapidly across multiple time zones.
title: Taylor Swift joked that 'jet lag is a choice.' A sleep expert has thoughts about that

description: House Republicans want to hold the attorney general in contempt over the department's refusal to hand over an audio recording of a special counsel's interview with the president.
title: Justice Department says Merrick Garland can't be held in contempt by Congress

description: Elizabeth O'Connor's spare and bracing debut novel provides a stark reckoning with what it means to be seen from the outside, both as a person and as a people.
title: 'Whale Fall' centers the push-and-pull between dreams and responsibilities

description: Biden and Trump have agreed to two presidential debate dates that break from tradition. Spending time outdoors daily can protect children from myopia.
title: Biden and Trump agree to two debates; how outdoor time can protect kids' eyesight

description: United Airlines is releasing a new safety video for the first time in years. The refresh comes as airlines struggle to hold the attention of passengers who are distracted by screens of their own.
title: With flyers more distracted than ever, United rolls out a rebooted safety video

description: Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant's harsh public critique of Israel's war strategy set off a political firestorm that could threaten Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's hold on power.
title: Israel has no plan for Gaza after Hamas rule, the Israeli defense chief says

description: New Republican-backed laws in several states add large fines or criminal penalties for minor mistakes in voter registration work. As groups pull back, they're reaching fewer voters.
title: Groups that register voters are feeling besieged by new state laws

description: When a private space traveler said he wanted to take a SpaceX capsule on a mission to improve the aging Hubble telescope, NASA studied the options. Internal emails show concern about the risk.
title: Private mission to save the Hubble Space Telescope raises concerns, NASA emails show

description: A suspect was in custody and the country's interior minister said that an initial investigation found "a clear political motivation" behind the attack on Prime Minister Robert Fico.
title: Slovak leader in serious but stable condition after assassination try, hospital says

description: The collision's impact sent pieces of the bridge, which connects Galveston to Pelican Island, tumbling on top of the barge and shut down a stretch of waterway so crews could clean up the spill.
title: Barge hits bridge connecting Galveston and Pelican Island, causing oil to spill
